VitaminC.why: A lack of VitaminC can cause swelling due to its role in maintaining healthy blood vessels and immune function. As a 29-year-old male, a lack of VitaminC may be more pronounced due to inadequate diet or increased oxidative stress.
VitaminC.tip: Incorporate VitaminC-rich foods into your daily meals, such as having a citrus fruit salad for breakfast.

Magnesium.why: A lack of Magnesium can lead to swelling due to its role in blood vessel relaxation and electrolyte balance. As a male with a relatively high weight, magnesium levels may be lower due to increased inflammation and oxidative stress.
Magnesium.tip: Engage in regular exercise, such as walking or jogging, to improve magnesium absorption and overall cardiovascular health.

Potassium.why: A lack of Potassium can cause swelling due to its role in maintaining healthy blood vessel function and electrolyte balance. As a 29-year-old male with a relatively high weight, potassium levels may be lower due to inadequate diet or increased sodium intake.
Potassium.tip: Limit processed food intake and choose potassium-rich foods to maintain a healthy electrolyte balance.

analyse.Urgency Note: No urgent medical concerns are flagged based on the provided information. However, if swelling persists or worsens, it is essential to consult a healthcare professional to rule out underlying medical conditions.
